Detailed Description

(Deployment Application) This Class is an iGraph representation of the network domain as this was read by the configuration file.

It is used for exporting the network domain representation to .graphML file that is later read by the Topology Manager, iGraph does that automatically, so no extra effort is required.

void GraphRepresentation::BuildInputMap ( void   ) 

Builds internal structures representation from an igraph instance.

It uses the igraph representation that is built from barabasi-albert algorithm and builds internal structures.

STEP 1: Assign Names to Vertices and put them in the lookup hash table

Create a straight map

Create the inverse map

update the network nodes

update graph info

STEP 2: Get the vertex pair for each edge in the array and update the domain map

Bitvector GraphRepresentation::calculateFID ( string &  source,
string &  destination 
)

It calculates a LIPSIN identifier from source node to destination node.

It is used to calculate the default LIPSIN identifiers from each node to the domain's RV and TM.

Parameters:
source the node label of the source node.
destination the node label of the destination node.
Returns:
A Bitvector object representing the LIPSIN identifier.
void GraphRepresentation::ChooseTheBestTMRVNode ( void   ) 

Chooses the best TM RV node by finding the node with the least distance from the rest.

Chooses the best TM RV node by finding the node with the least distance from the rest. It sets the RV TM in the internal deployment tool graph representation
